variables.POINT_1: They focus on perfection instead of shipping
variables.POINT_2: They build in a vacuum without market feedback
variables.POINT_3: They wait for the 'perfect' time to launch

variables.HOOK: 7 passive income streams that changed my life:
The biggest lesson I learned building a 6-figure business:
variables.POINT_1: Focus on ONE thing and master it completely
variables.POINT_2: Then scale it systematically before adding complexity

variables.HOOK: 3 business principles that doubled my revenue:
Here's what I learned building a 6-figure business:
variables.STORY: I started with $0 and built it to $100k in 12 months
variables.INSIGHT: The secret? Focus on ONE thing and master it completely

variables.HOOK: 7 passive income streams I'm using right now:

You don't need 100K followers to make money on social media.

You need the right strategy.

Here's how to make your first $1,000 with 2,000 followers:
variables.POINT_1:
Don't try everything at once.

Focus on one of these at a time:
‚Ä¢ Digital products (requires traffic)
‚Ä¢ Coaching/Consulting (requires expertise)
‚Ä¢ Affiliate marketing (requires a lot of clicks)
‚Ä¢ Sponsored content (requires some following)

Master one, then add another.
variables.POINT_2:
Start simple:

‚Ä¢ Notion template ($19)
‚Ä¢ PDF guide ($29)
‚Ä¢ Mini course ($97)

Solve ONE specific problem.
variables.POINT_3:
Social media = rented land.

Email = owned land.

Give away a freebie:
‚Ä¢ Checklist
‚Ä¢ Template
‚Ä¢ Guide
variables.POINT_4:
Don't just post.

Engage:
‚Ä¢ Reply to comments
‚Ä¢ Answer DMs
‚Ä¢ Join conversations

Relationships = revenue.
variables.POINT_5:
Before you have products, offer services:

‚Ä¢ 1-on-1 coaching ($200/session)
‚Ä¢ Content creation ($500/month)
‚Ä¢ Strategy calls ($150/hour)
variables.POINT_6:
What converts?
‚Ä¢ Which posts drive sales?
‚Ä¢ What content gets DMs?
‚Ä¢ Where do customers come from?

Double down on what works.
variables.POINT_7:
Don't compete on price but on value.

If you solve a $10,000 problem, charge $2,000 and the client will return.
variables.POINT_8:
One launch isn't enough.

Promote your product:
‚Ä¢ Weekly emails
‚Ä¢ Monthly posts
‚Ä¢ Quarterly campaigns
variables.POINT_9:
First $1,000 takes the longest.

Then it gets easier:
‚Ä¢ Month 1-2: $0
‚Ä¢ Month 3-6: $1000
‚Ä¢ Month 7-9: $3000
‚Ä¢ Month 10-12: $5000+

Keep going.
variables.FINAL_CTA:
What's your first revenue stream going to be? üëá

variables.HOOK:
How to go viral in 2026?

Let me show the tools and strategies you should use to grow 100,000+ followers (check commentsüëá)
variables.WHY_IT_MATTERS:
But first...why going viral actually matters?

Here's what one viral content can do:
‚Üí 10K, 20K or 100K new followers who didn't know you existed
‚Üí Inbound opportunities you'd spend months chasing otherwise
‚Üí Social proof that makes people take you seriously
‚Üí Authority in your niche overnight

I've seen people land $20K clients from one viral thread. Get podcast invitations. Build entire businesses off the momentum of a single post.

The catch? Most people have no idea how to make it happen consistently.
variables.STRATEGY_1_TITLE: Steal Proven Structures (Don't Reinvent the Wheel)
variables.STRATEGY_1_CONTENT:
Original content is overrated. Viral content follows patterns.

Find threads in your niche that got millions of views. Study the structure. Recreate it with your own angle.

The framework did the heavy lifting. You just need to execute.

For example, this guy literally copied all my viral video formats and jumped from 0 to almost 300K followers in just a few months!üëáÔ∏è
variables.STRATEGY_2_CONTENT:
Nobody reads past the first line unless you earn it. Sometimes I realize I made a bad video hook after going live and regretting not working on it more.

Bad hook: "Here are some tips for productivity..."

Viral hook: "I wasted 3 years being 'busy' instead of productive. Here's what actually works:"

Lead with curiosity, controversy, or a bold claim. Everything else is noise.

Focus on the hook more. That's my goal for 2026.
variables.STRATEGY_3_TITLE: Use Meme Comments to Hijack Viral Posts
variables.STRATEGY_3_CONTENT:
This is the fastest engagement hack nobody talks about. Find posts with 100K+ views in your niche (posted max 24 hours prior). Drop a meme comment in the first 100 comments

Result: 1k or 5k likes, 1000s of profile visits, 100s of followers

You don't make content. You strategically place yourself where attention already is

This is why I built the viral meme library in ViralSky so you don't have to hunt for memes that work

Try https://www.viralsky.ai/
variables.STRATEGY_4_CONTENT:
Everyone says "jump on trends early" but that's garbage advice. By the time you see a trend, it's already saturated.

Here's what actually works:

Find posts in your niche that blew up in the last 24-48 hours. Not weeks ago. Not months ago. Yesterday.

Then create your own take on that exact topic while it's still hot.

Why this works: The algorithm is already pushing that topic. People are already searching for it.

You surf the wave, not create it.
variables.STRATEGY_5_CONTENT:
Stop starting from scratch every time. I've written threads that got 100M+ views. The secret?

I use the same structures over and over. Example template: "RIP xyz". Here are 10 better alternatives.

This works for business advice, personal stories, how-to guides, literally everything.

All my million-view templates are inside https://www.viralsky.ai/ if you want the exact structures I use.

No guessing required. Just copy paste them. Plans start at only $5.
variables.CONCLUSION:
6. Going viral in 2025 isn't luck. It's not talent.

It's knowing what works and doing it consistently. You can spend the next year experimenting and hoping something hits...

Or you can copy what's already proven. Your call.

If you want the shortcut: ViralSky gives you the meme comments library, thread templates, and AI thread generator to go viral constantly.

Check it out here. Now go make something blow up.
variables.BONUS: BONUS: Get a yearly plan and you'll be on an onboarding call (optional) with me.

variables.TITLE: The Creator Mindset: How to Think Like a Successful Creator
variables.HOOK:
Success isn't about tactics.

It's about mindset.

Here's how successful creators think:
variables.POINT_1_CONTENT:
Most creators quit in 3 months.

Successful creators think in years.

They know:
‚Ä¢ Month 1-3: Learning
‚Ä¢ Month 4-6: Building
‚Ä¢ Month 7-12: Growing
‚Ä¢ Year 2+: Scaling

Play the long game.
variables.POINT_2_CONTENT:
Every failure is data.

‚Ä¢ Post flopped? Learn why.
‚Ä¢ Product didn't sell? Iterate.
‚Ä¢ Collaboration failed? Move on.

Fail fast. Learn faster.
variables.POINT_3_CONTENT:
Don't think "what can I get?"

Think "what can I give?"

‚Ä¢ Free content
‚Ä¢ Helpful replies
‚Ä¢ Valuable insights
‚Ä¢ Genuine connections

Value compounds.
variables.POINT_4_CONTENT:
Don't guess. Measure.

Track:
‚Ä¢ What works
‚Ä¢ What doesn't
‚Ä¢ Why it works
‚Ä¢ How to improve

Data > opinions.
variables.POINT_5_CONTENT:
Your first version will suck.

That's okay.

Ship ‚Üí Learn ‚Üí Improve ‚Üí Repeat.

Progress > perfection.
variables.POINT_6_CONTENT:
Other creators aren't competition.

They're community.

‚Ä¢ Collaborate
‚Ä¢ Support
‚Ä¢ Learn together
‚Ä¢ Grow together

Rising tide lifts all boats.
variables.POINT_7_CONTENT:
Motivation fades.

Systems don't.

Build systems:
‚Ä¢ Content calendar
‚Ä¢ Creation process
‚Ä¢ Engagement routine
‚Ä¢ Review schedule

Systems create success.
variables.FINAL_CTA:
What mindset shift do you need to make? üëá

variables.TITLE: How to build a personal brand that attracts opportunities
variables.HOOK:
Your personal brand is your most valuable asset.

It's what opens doors before you even ask.

Here's how to build one instantlyüëá
variables.POINT_1_CONTENT:
You can't be known for everything.

Pick ONE thing:
‚Ä¢ "The productivity guy"
‚Ä¢ "The SaaS marketer"
‚Ä¢ "The creator economy expert"

Own it.
variables.POINT_2_CONTENT:
What makes you different?

‚Ä¢ Your perspective
‚Ä¢ Your stories
‚Ä¢ Your style

Don't copy. Be authentic.
variables.POINT_3_CONTENT:
Brands are built through repetition.

Post daily:
‚Ä¢ Your thoughts
‚Ä¢ Your learnings
‚Ä¢ Your journey

People remember what they see often.
variables.POINT_4_CONTENT:
Don't just be on one platform:

‚Ä¢ Twitter/X
‚Ä¢ LinkedIn
‚Ä¢ Instagram
‚Ä¢ YouTube
‚Ä¢ Newsletter

Same message, different formats.
variables.POINT_5_CONTENT:
Before asking for anything:

‚Ä¢ Share knowledge
‚Ä¢ Help others
‚Ä¢ Give templates
‚Ä¢ Answer questions

Value builds trust.
variables.POINT_6_CONTENT:
People connect with stories:

‚Ä¢ Your failures
‚Ä¢ Your wins
‚Ä¢ Your journey
‚Ä¢ Your lessons

Be vulnerable. Be real.
variables.POINT_7_CONTENT:
Brands aren't built overnight.

It takes:
‚Ä¢ 6 months to be recognized
‚Ä¢ 1 year to be trusted
‚Ä¢ 2 years to be influential

Keep going.
variables.FINAL_CTA:
What's your personal brand going to be known for? üëá
